summary: The Eviction Right to Counsel Act of 2025 aims to provide grants to state and local governments that enact or are responsible for implementing legislation guaranteeing legal representation to low-income tenants facing eviction. The bill defines key terms like "covered individual," "covered proceeding," and "right to counsel legislation." It establishes the Eviction Right to Counsel Fund, authorizing appropriations to support grant programs. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will administer the grants, prioritizing entities with additional tenant protections and those focused on attorney training and recruitment.
